\title{Bug Report}
\date{May 22, 2025}

\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
I wanted to cross compile a simple GLFW + GLAD app from a Windows X86\_64
Host to a Linux X86\_64 Target by using a LLVM toolchain, both custom and
builtin.To that end I acquired GLFW by cloning the repository and GLAD
by using the generator. I used a docker container to obtain a sysroot
containing libraries to link against. But xmake failed to build the GLFW
package with cmake.


\chapter{Steps to Reproduce}
\label{\detokenize{index:steps-to-reproduce}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Acquire llvm toolchain by compiling from source
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
scoop\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }make\PYG{+w}{ }cmake\PYG{+w}{ }python
git\PYG{+w}{ }clone\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}recursive\PYG{+w}{ }git@github.com:tcottin/llvm\PYGZhy{}project.git
\PYG{n+nb}{cd}\PYG{+w}{ }llvm\PYGZhy{}project
git\PYG{+w}{ }switch\PYG{+w}{ }clangd\PYGZhy{}doxygen\PYGZhy{}parser
cmake\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}S\PYG{+w}{ }llvm\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}B\PYG{+w}{ }build\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}G\PYG{+w}{ }Ninja\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}ENABLE\PYGZus{}EH\PYG{o}{=}ON\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}ENABLE\PYGZus{}RTTI\PYG{o}{=}ON\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}ENABLE\PYGZus{}ASSERTIONS\PYG{o}{=}ON\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}TARGETS\PYGZus{}TO\PYGZus{}BUILD\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}X86;ARM;AArch64;RISCV;WebAssembly\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DCMAKE\PYGZus{}BUILD\PYGZus{}TYPE\PYG{o}{=}Release\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}ENABLE\PYGZus{}PROJECTS\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}clang;lld;clang\PYGZhy{}tools\PYGZhy{}extra;lldb\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZca{}
\PYG{+w}{    }\PYGZhy{}DLLVM\PYGZus{}ENABLE\PYGZus{}RUNTIMES\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}libcxx;compiler\PYGZhy{}rt;libcxxabi\PYGZdq{}}
ninja\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}S\PYG{+w}{ }build\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}j
cmake\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}install\PYG{+w}{ }build\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}prefix\PYG{+w}{ }C:/dev/llvm
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Acquire the dev branch of xmake by downloading
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{xmake\sphinxhyphen{}dev.win64.exe}} from the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Releases}} in the github
repository and running it

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Acquire the sysroot by running a debian:bookworm image then
installing dependencies with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{apt}}, or just use the one I provided
at the repo
\begin{quote}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
docker\PYG{+w}{ }pull\PYG{+w}{ }debian:bookworm
docker\PYG{+w}{ }run\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}it\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}\PYGZhy{}name\PYG{o}{=}deb\PYG{+w}{ }debian:bookworm
apt\PYG{+w}{ }update\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }apt\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }apt\PYG{+w}{ }install\PYG{+w}{ }libc6\PYGZhy{}dev\PYG{+w}{ }libstdc++\PYGZhy{}12\PYGZhy{}dev\PYG{+w}{ }libc++\PYGZhy{}dev\PYG{+w}{ }libc++abi\PYGZhy{}dev\PYG{+w}{ }libwayland\PYGZhy{}dev
exit\PYG{p}{;}\PYG{+w}{ }docker\PYG{+w}{ }\PYG{n+nb}{export}\PYG{+w}{ }deb\PYG{+w}{ }\PYGZhy{}o\PYG{+w}{ }deb.tar
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
\end{quote}

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Export the sysroot by using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{7z}} with admin rights

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
Try out examples I provided

\end{enumerate}


\chapter{What do I expect}
\label{\detokenize{index:what-do-i-expect}}\begin{enumerate}
\sphinxsetlistlabels{\arabic}{enumi}{enumii}{}{.}%
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
You should be able to compile the examples and see them working in a
Linux OS Machines

\end{enumerate}
